parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise, lift up. From epi and airo; to raise up.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Feminine 2nd Person Plural
str2: Your, yours. From humeis; yours, i.e. Pertaining to you.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
